intro: Hieracium candicans proles gougetianum, commonly known as the Gouget's showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a perennial species, often forming dense colonies in its native habitat.
